Reviews.Content: Gave this camera as a gift on a trip and did not realize it did not come with a battery.  Unfortunately, we don't know how well it works because we did not have time to get a battery before the trip.  Did I miss something in the description?  On the plus side, camera came quickly.

Reviews.Title: Very handy little camera
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I want a camera to take outdoors in all weather conditions and to geotag each picture while hiking, kayaking and geocaching.  After my cute little Casio GPS camera died from inhaling a few drops of water during it's transition to and from zip-lock bags while I was kayaking, I was looking for a replacement.  The Casio had a nice 10x optical zoom, but alas, that too had proved vulnerable to my clumsiness, requiring a couple of repairs over the years.  So:  I wanted a camera that was waterproof, rugged, easy to use, would take decent pictures, fit in my pocket, and tell me where I was at the time of the shot.  This one seemed to fit the bill despite being purple so I decided to give it a try.  I've had the camera for a couple of months and several thousand photos now and it gets the 5 stars because it does those six things as well as I could hope for.  It fits in my front pants pocket with the lanyard sticking out so I can grab it with gloved hands easily.  The battery generally gets me through the days (you do need a spare one:  they charge in a few hours.)  This first shot of the day takes 10 seconds or so to lock on to the satellites, after that it's 2 seconds or less, and the positions are reasonably accurate.  The LCD view screen works well, which is to say it's a far cry from a decent SLR view finder, but you have some idea of what's in the view frame outdoors.  The camera manual is 230 pages long, so it's not that simple, but lets say there's potential I haven't explored yet and the basic functions are pretty simple to understand and use.  You can charge the battery in the camera, but you won't want to.  Much easier to use a separate charger and swap out batteries.  The internal memory has enough capacity to be useful on those days you forget to stick a memory card in (again, easier to have a spare).  My routine after a day's shooting is to pull out the card and the battery, put the spare ones in, close the camera back up and its set to go again in 10 seconds.  This is a great little camera for my uses.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Dixon
Reviews.Content: I had seen several people use this camera for investigative work because of the macro capability of this camera.  I have had great success with this function already.  The camera also works very well with everyday uses.  The only downside I have found is that sometimes it takes a couple of seconds to process an image and causes a pause before the next shot.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who needs a nice macro option.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera packs a punch!
Reviews.Author: Jimmy the Geek
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, especially close ups.  Ruggedly built, but I wish it had a lens cover just the same.The only nit I have is the annoyance of dealing with yet another special USB connector, requiring you to carry yet another cable in your bag!  They could have used one of the standard micro-USB connectors for the same size.  Oh well, if that's the worst you can say about an item, that's still pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Great Knock Around
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have multiple cameras, some I don't want to use on a boat, in the rain or in the cold.  I'm also hard on small objects and when working quickly I can have dropsy.  So I wanted to have something durable.  Although if you use the optional AC connection or the computer interface cable, the cord hanging out is a bit awkward and I'm concerned about damaging the floppy battery door that has to stay open during AC and computer use.  I've use it for classroom use as a video camera for student projects.  I would prefer to have an external mic jack (the only strong selling point for me for the Hero), but the sound quality has been acceptable and the quality of the video is as good as one might expect for a multi-use camera.  I read several reviews that compared this to other waterproof and durable cameras (Sony, Olympus, Hero) and this once compared well at all levels.  Primarily I chose this because of its low f stop, its 16 MPGs, its durability, its picture quality for point and shoot, its competitive price, and its size. There is little optical zoom, but I did not necessarily want much and suspect that it would compromise the weatherproof nature of camera if there was much of an optical zoom.  I use other cameras for more serious picture taking but I like having this one around.

Reviews.Title: More than what I expected.
Reviews.Author: D. Berry "bullet6055"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I lost my old pocket camera and this one was on sale. It comes with more features than I expected which is nice. It takes a nice crisp photo but you do need to read the book, it's not just a point and shoot camera. This is a good upgrade for someone who wants to move up from the simple camera  but not want to invest in a DSLR. The only drawback is that the internal memory is limited to 30 photos or a short video so if you want to take more you will have to buy a flash card, not included.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof, but doesn't take good underwater photos.
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: Pro: This camera is rugged and can handle a beating.  It has also maintained a good waterproof casing.  This has been fun to have at a waterpark and while swimming just because I don't have to worry about it getting damaged.Con:  I have a friend who bought a waterproof, point-and-shoot camera for $100 less that takes way clearer, more vibrant underwater photos than this one.  I live in a fabulous snorkeling area and most of the pictures I take with this camera come out blurry.  I regret paying so much for this camera and would not choose this model again.

Reviews.Title: My favorite digital camera.
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I hike and backpack and enjoy kayaking, and so we need a waterproof camera.  In 20 years, we've used and abused three different brands of watetproof camera.  This is our fourth.  We came back to Pentax Optio because we had owned one before and it gave us the most reliable performance.  It never broke down - we lost it.  The others we bought each eventually failed.  We found Pentax Optio to be reliable.  Only downside is the proprietary batteries, but we've learned to live with them.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater shots, not so good in bright sun light
Reviews.Author: Jagerfoods
Reviews.Content: My wife received this camera for her birthday and she really likes the color and simplicity of it. It has a rugged shell and the buttons are laid out similar to the Cannon camera we already owned.This camera is very easy to use, right out of the box. The set up is very easy with the step by step instructions. The carabiner attachment that's included works well for attaching the camera on your backpack or pant loops. I was hesitant to use it because I was afraid it would scratch the glass view finder or the lens. For underwater photography you should invest in a floating wrist holder.We went on a sailing trip shortly after I purchased the camera and were able to field test the Pentax Optio WG-3 in the Caribbean waters of Belize. In bright sunshine it can be difficult to see what you're looking at on the glass viewer. At one point we noticed a small cloudy spot on the glass and we thought moisture got inside, but the spot went away within a few minutes. We figured the camera must have been set out in the sun too long.My wife and I were able to take fantastic underwater pictures right from the start. We photographed color reef and moving fish with ease. We also took several video, on the boat as well as underwater and they came out looking awesome.The software that comes with the camera is user friendly and allows you to manipulate your photos with different themes. You can also crop, re-size and do a number of other things with it, like add text, etc. The video editor is very simple and could be a bit more involved.This is our first underwater camera and we are very happy with it so far.You can see the photos we took on our blog at [...]

Reviews.Title: Very unique and agile camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory L.
Reviews.Content: I bought it for its Macro capability, which is excellent.  However, this rugged little camera is good for all ranges.  It's underwater and damage proof case makes it an excellent choice for forensic engineering work.

Reviews.Title: Meeting expectations so far
Reviews.Author: Terry Jensen
Reviews.Content: We previously had an Optio W90 that worked real well for several years.  We've found the WG-3 to be superior to the W90 and have been pleased with our photos so far.  There are some features that we haven't tested yet, but are anxious to try.

Reviews.Title: Like but don't love
Reviews.Author: bwanc
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty cool, but luckily it's only a backup camera.  I'm a casual user, not a camera guru, so take my opinion as you wish...PROS: EXCELLENT MACRO ability.  I was playing with this feature and was amazed.  Very user friendly.  This camera has a very intuitive function menu.  It has little icons with a brief explanation for each feature, making it easy to pick the right one.  Of course the waterproof feature is a big plus, hoping the previous reviews of leaks doesn't come true for me.  But this leads me into the CONS:  The only way to charge the camera is to open the waterproof compartment that houses the memory card and plug in the PROVIDED USB cable.  So the camera has to sit, open, while the camera charges.  The waterproofing design of the lid does not look substantial so great care must be taken when working in this area of the camera.  You also have to make sure it is spotlessly clean before closing it to prevent water seepage.  I mentioned "provided" USB cable.  I tried using some wall plug-ins for USB that I already had laying around the house.  They did not work for this camera.  I finally used the wall charger provided and the camera charged.  Now, not sure if the USB cable will charge the camera if plugged into the car USB port (as an example).  Lastly, the lens crystal/cover is pretty open to the elements.  It's a little concerning that it could be easliy scratched.  But no evidence of such so far.  The last comment is that this camera has a little bit of zoom, but nothing to brag about.  I bought it with a no-zoom thought in mind.  Anyway, it appears to be a fun and usable camera.  I hope it lives up to its advertised standards.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fun family camera
Reviews.Author: Caitiemama
Reviews.Content: We were shopping for a point and shoot when my husband discovered this little beast. It is amazing and fun. We've had it under water a few times already and our 5 year old daughter loves that she can take pictures with it too. We chose it for this reason, she seems to be a budding photographer and we wanted her to be able to explore that with a higher quality camera that was basically indestructible. We have a Nikon dslr for grown ups only but we use this one a lot. It's perfect to keep in your purse, diaper bag or you can clip it to your belt loop.

Reviews.Title: all around great all weather camera
Reviews.Author: brdinclt
Reviews.Content: fast lense of high quality, intuitive controls, gps, macro rocks!  sturdy design.  front readout a plus. great view screen.  colors cool but subdued.  first images sharp.  13x19 images made on canon Pixma Pro 9500 are great.

Reviews.Title: most durable camera I have ever owned,
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: most durable camera I have ever owned, my three year old son takes this thing everywhere, only downside is the batter charging must be done via a cable, I prefer a battery dock, have had various HP cameras that survived a while but did not hold up to ocean water, so far holds up to combat operations, three year old operations, and the ocean.  protect the screen as I have seen it get cracked on two of my colleagues cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with lots of features
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: This was brought as a replacement for a canon d20.  The cannon stop working after 14 months and Canon wanted $200 plus to review it.  For that kind of money I could buy the Pentax which so far appears to be a better camera.  It has more options, as good picture quality, better video, making it a much better buy than canon.  The camera I purchased does not have the GPS option, because i never used it on other cameras, so why spend the money.  The camera is use by grand kids, tested in their play, swimming and caving, dropped and covered with mud and keeps on working.  I did buy the Wasabi battery pack, (grand kids use up batteries). Having taken over 800 picture and several video I am currently very pleased with this camera, but ask me in 14 months.

Reviews.Title: Great for a rugged camera. Awesome lens
Reviews.Author: Hawaiian Outdoors Lover
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for one main pourpose: snorkelling. I live in Hawaii and I see Turtles and fish every time I go snorkelling. My ols Olympus tough camera was not so good under water. It's metal body was great, but scratched easily, showed dings easily, and started to rust (even though I clean it every time I take it in the ocean).So I looked at this camera. The physical design is amazing. Tough but grippy to hold. The lens lets in so much light and takes great underwater photos. The screen is big and easily used. I have two issues with this camera:1 - The menu system feels clunky and below par for a camera like this. Pixel-y icons and slightly difficult to use. I had to read the manual to use this properly. It does work well, I was just hoping for a better interface.2 - the memory card and battery cover could use a better locking mechanism. It does not leak, it works well, but to open it all you do is pull one tab down and another tab across and it opens. I would like something a little more secure.Overall: this camera inspires confidence that it can take massive amounts of abuse, and still work great. And why bother with the GPS version.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera option!
Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: Camera is wonderful and takes amazing photos, even in the water. Tons of photography modes to choose from and one of our favorites modes is the time lapse video! So much fun!

Reviews.Title: Best tough camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: I'm a fisheries biologist, and a naturalist so I use and abuse my cameras. I've had Fuji, Canon, and Nikon tough cameras and the pentax is by far the best. Most tough cameras trade the picture quality for durability. This camera doesn't, and in my opinion the Pentax Optio WG-3 takes better macro pictures than my Canon Eos because of the ease of use and quality. I haven't used the camera in water yet, but I hope to take underwater pictures and video of fish swimming. I also use the camera when I am working in the water. I haven't dropped it in the water yet, but it feels and looks like it will hold up. The only complaint I have is that the GPS isn't completely accurate. It will work fine for personal use, but if you need accurate GPS coordinates use a GPS unit with WAAS. The GPS also takes up a lot of battery, so if you have a GPS on you maybe just use the GPS instead of you camera.All in all I love this camera, and hope to use it until it falls apart :) Five stars!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Photos
Reviews.Author: Mike Castellow
Reviews.Content: I routinely take photos for my job that require both a macro type view and in dark confined spaces and this is the best camera that I have used for my job. No regrets on my purchase at all.

Reviews.Title: Rugged and takes great photos
Reviews.Author: Jay Putnam "Jay P."
Reviews.Content: We have only used this camera for about a week. It takes excellent photos and is just what we were looking for after using other $200 cameras with extending lenses could not take the abuse we dish out. We use them on construction sites with lots of dirt, mud, wet, dropped and what ever. This camera looks like it will stand up. Only time will tell, but it is very well constructed.

Reviews.Title: great features but ...
Reviews.Author: Jerry Isdale
Reviews.Content: I really like the features and the pictures from this camera,,, however after a couple months of use, the LCD suddenly went dark gray - not dead black, gray where you could sorta see shadows of what was trying to be shown. I returned it to Pentax service and a few weeks later it (or one like it) returned.  Now some of the buttons on the back seem to have stopped working... first the zoom and now the flash.  Guess I'll have to return it *again*... living in Hawaii means it will cost $40+ just for shipping.Not at all what I expect from an "adventure proof" camera

Reviews.Title: WG-3
Reviews.Author: RLJR
Reviews.Content: Love it! Took some great shots on the lake and under the lake as well. I even captured the sounds under the water! I get a true sense for the actual colors. The camera is a little slow to process the pix after taken. The zoom is great. The only down about the camera? The view screen is easily scratched and no eye site to peer through!

Reviews.Title: It takes a nice photo, but its fragile...
Reviews.Author: David Grimm
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the photos this camera managed to capture the first few months of its life.  However, it was in a camera bag and the bag fell off my parked motorcycle seat (32 inches) and the fall managed to break the screen.  Not very rugged for a camera that claims to be "Adventure Proof."  Looking on the Pentax web site for an email to get a service quote proved to be a waste of time.So while the picture quality was nice (not great, but still good) the claims of shockproof from falls up to 6 1/2 feet are not accurate.  Given this, I wouldn't be in a great hurry to test the limits of its other claims (waterproof to 45 ft, freeze proof to 10ºc, and crushproof).So I'd look and other cameras if you need an "Adventure Proof" camera to take with you on your next adventure.

Reviews.Title: save you money - don't buy it, it's a defective design, not waterproof as stated
Reviews.Author: PP
Reviews.Content: In fact this ought to be my first review on Amazon but I really couldn't bear with my fury - I bought this for vacation in Bali. With 20 min seawalker and another 20 min diving both only 15ft deep (the product brags 45ft waterproof) yesterday, it's finished - water leaked in very easily, like some of the other reviews mentioned. I'm sure I absolutely didn't operate anything wrong as I'm a IT/tech-oriented guy. Save your money, don't buy this crap, it's designed with natural flaw - just does everything but serious waterproof. Now I'm going to try to file a claim and have to buy another waterproof cam for next tours.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: I should have "listened" to the "bad reviews", we bought this for my son's trip and it worked fine the first day and then refused to turn on, three beeps and nothing, even after fully charging it.  Pentax, you have a problem !

Reviews.Title: Nice little tool and camera from Pentax!
Reviews.Author: TOPRAKBASTI
Reviews.Content: This is a great water-proof camera that you can let kids (i.e. teens) to use without any worry. We got this unit before our trip to Punta Cana (Dominican Republic) and the camera performed brilliantly, allowing kids to enjoy underwater (both pool and ocean) shots and videos. I like Pentax as a brand (I am a happy owner of a Pentax K-x DSLR), so my affinity with the brand might have played a role preferring this over other similar cameras but so far I am very happy with my purchase and this equipment also passed the durability/performance test in my kids' hands. What is more, it is a nice photography tool that supports features like Microscopy Mode (i.e. super Macro) which you place the camera on top of the subject (there is a special lens holder provided in the box for this mode) and take extreme close-ups of objects of interest, slow-motion video, panoramic stills, etc.. If you or your young kids are into such experimental photography, this is a great equipment to have.I have been happy with image and video quality. I will not go into the details of how nice, crisp, accurate, etc.. picture quality is, simply it provides enough image quality to satisfy most users out there.One issue I observed with this unit was during the re-charge of the battery. Re-charging of the provided re-chargeable battery is done with the provided USB-cable and the power adaptor. When I first plugged in the USB cable, the green light on the ON/OFF switch did NOT start blinking (to indicate successful re-charging process). I was afraid that there was sth wrong with the camera or battery but after shuffling the cable, unplugging and plugging back it in, the green light started to blink as expected and the battery charged as expected. Similar thing happened in subsequent battery chargings but it is always resolved like above, so it looks like loose connection somewhere on the path which is easily fixable.In summary, if you need a relatively cheap and tough camera (i.e. water-proof, shock-proof, etc..) this unit is certainly worth considering and recommended.

Reviews.Title: Not working camera
Reviews.Author: SERGIO NEUSPILLER
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a trip to Galapagos.Once start using it I found the camera was not working fine. Pentax has almost no support at LATAM.I had to return it to Arizona an lost my chance to use it on the trip.

Reviews.Title: Pentax WG-3
Reviews.Author: David John Sawley
Reviews.Content: Great camera, loaded with features and performance. I took it snorkelling the day I got it - didn't test the max.45ft depth, but no problem at 15ft. Excellent photos and videos under water.Just getting into the editing features.no problems to report..

Reviews.Title: Made it through one day at the beach.
Reviews.Author: Tralfaz
Reviews.Content: I may have just gotten a lemon, but after one day at the beach and about an hour of snorkeling, and a good 10 hour wait for it to dry off before opening the case to get to the SD card, the LCD screen failed, rendering the camera pretty much useless. I know that asking for a camera that can be submerged is a big task, but it says right there "WATERPROOF," though it clearly is not.

Reviews.Title: camera great, manual sucks
Reviews.Author: MARK
Reviews.Content: Camera great, attachments seem in order.  Manual and other written materials are in the Japanese language, no help any time all. No SD memory card included.

Reviews.Title: Great product, delivered on time.
Reviews.Author: Michael Merrifield
Reviews.Content: Great product and delivered when promised, very nice camera. Would recommend it to my friends and family. Can't wait to try the underwater video.

Reviews.Title: Pentax WaterProof Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Took camera on vacation where I used it 20 ft underwater and it was outstanding. Took fantastic pictures. Only wish I had purchased the strap. I bought the orange colored one and I had no trouble seeing it and keeping track of it. The view finder with the focus bar was way cool - I could align my photo perfectly. I even had strangers use it to take photos of my husband and me - and they were impressed by how easy it was to focus. Great photos, great memories!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great pictures at Niagra Falls. Took pictures from the Maid of tho Mist and behind the falls. Water -no problem. Video mode - super results.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: VA Buyer
Reviews.Content: Does everything I need with high quality! Pictures and video come out great. Still getting use to all the features, but really happy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera.  My favorite features so far are the single button video recording, waterproof, and easy playback.

Reviews.Title: thrilled
Reviews.Author: roy
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Small, light, just the right amount of texture to maintain a good grip.  That coupled with being 15 metre waterproof

Reviews.Title: extremely compact and does the job well.
Reviews.Author: marissa klein
Reviews.Content: i usually use a nikon dslr but i bought this because i needed a rugged compact camera that i can take underwater pictures with. this camera does well in low light, and has nice high contrast in sufficient light with bright, vivid color. the macro is very useful and the lights give it a little extra boost that you may need if you're super close to the subject.here's a picture i took at 8 pm. it was much darker out than it appears here.[...]and here's a digital microscope picture i took[...]

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Lisl P "Lisl P"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera. It takes great underwater photos and seems more durable than my last waterproof camera. I need a camera that I can throw in my beach bag/back pack and not worry about and this certainly fits the bill--while still taking great photos! I have now talked my friend into purchasing the same one.

Reviews.Title: Got two of them
Reviews.Author: Pablo Montes
Reviews.Content: I love them, they got four stars because the batery self discharges in two or three days, but all the options make it the perfect camera for the outdoors type.

Reviews.Title: outstanding
Reviews.Author: Blackburnian "books, books and more books"
Reviews.Content: I've owned many cameras, and my latest have all been Canon dslrs- but this little gem is an impressive alternative when I don't want to carry about my heavy equipment. Nice clear photos and easy to understand settings. Happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, many features, flawless construction
Reviews.Author: R. Burnette
Reviews.Content: I looked at all of the top-rated rugged cameras from Consumer Reports but none seemed right.  I've been a Pentax fan for years (before Ricoh bought it) and bought this on that basis.  I've not tried it underwater but in all other circumstances it has been great. The recharger is a bit fussy and takes a couple of hours to complete the cycle--but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: Not really waterproof
Reviews.Author: Dorcha Boisen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a 16 day Grand Canyon River trip.  It worked great for the first few days but after it got wet a few times most of the buttons stopped working.  I was able to continue taking pictures but could not zoom, change settings, or view pictures taken.  When I got home I promptly contacted the seller, DavisMAX, but they said I had to contact Pentax directly even though the camera is only 4 months old.  Now I'm in the process of that and I'm wishing I had gone with a different camera/seller.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera for whitewater boating!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Bailey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip down the Grand Canyon. I was guiding an 18' oar boat and kayaking for the 21 day trip. I kept the camera caribinered to my PFD the entire time I was on the trip. It was fully submerged over and over again and even (accidentally) spent a night fully submerged. The picture quality was great and it even did really well on a tripod taking night shots (with a 2 second timer to reduce shake). The battery life is fairly decent with the exception of taking videos as they use it up much faster. I took off the canyon and let a buddy borrow it for his trip the next week. He just got back and he's going to buy one after having used it on the canyon as well. It was great to be able to kayak a rapid, catch an eddy, and pull the camera out to shoot everyone else going through the rapids. I didn't have to get out of my boat or even undue my sprayskirt. I would HIGHLY recommend this camera. Boom!

Reviews.Title: Suits my purpose
Reviews.Author: Jose Almonte
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good water proof camera to take pictures while kayaking on the Hudson River. The WG-3 will be just fine for the job.The negatives are that when using the extreme telephoto, the image is not too sharp. The other negative is the whirring sound it makes when using the telephoto in video mode.I have not used it for under water pictures or video yet, but that is not my main use. The previous camera got wet in salt water and fizzed out.I would recommend this camera for general water use. For the price it is good.  Also, I would use water proof bag for under water use just in case.This camera is fairly well shaped, fits in the hand and fits easily in a shirt pocket or jeans pockets, but would not recommend unless you can protect the lens and screen.

Reviews.Title: Good Photos but too much glare
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  Our last underwater camera didn't make it all the way through one dive trip when it started leaking.  This is a great idea with the charging pad and the wi-fi download, we won't ever have to open the battery chamber again.My only complaint is that I had a hard time with the glare when I was on top of the water or close to the surface.  Good value.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Caller
Reviews.Content: All with that you can Dream!Best Quality Underwater photo!Easy use.  The body is a hard plastic that almost feels like a rubber texture.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: James Robinson
Reviews.Content: This is my second Pentax camera. My other one is a DSLR K10, which I love, but is not so great for everyday spontaneous snapshots.That is why I was looking for a high quality knockabout camera.I am very glad I decided to purchase the WG-3 for the following reasons:First off, the menu is simple, especially if you are familiar with Pentax. Once it's set-you're done.The presets are surprisingly good for a point-and-shoot; and there is one for virtual any situation.The videos are high quality for camera-remember this is not video camera.I have used it hiking and shot hand-held in very low light in the forest, and the results were surprisingly sharp.It also compensates for the strange lighting found in indoor arenas without distorting the skin tones or causing excessive graininess.I'm going to the beach next week, and since some of the reviewers complained of water intrusion, I tested my camera under the sink with no water intrusion (I agree with some of the reviewer that said the problem was operator error, not camera problem). Can't wait to use it at the beach, and will post follow up review of on and under water performance.Overall, this is a great camera, and I give it my wholehearted endorsement.

Reviews.Title: specs good for the $
Reviews.Author: Michael Keller
Reviews.Content: specs good for the $, up to 46 feet for a minor camera.its on its first UW jaunt now.  hope it works well.

Reviews.Title: Simple and effective
Reviews.Author: tbone4379
Reviews.Content: It takes very good pictures and it stands up to its promises of crush proof, water proof, dust proof. The pictures aren't as good as you'll get from a DSLR, but they were good enough for me. The video is also very good. The shake proof is awesome for pictures when I was moving or for low light scenarios. Also the picture stitching and panorama modes allow you to take wide-angle style pictures - obviously not as good as a real wide-angle lens but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: What a terrific little camera
Reviews.Author: Kitty Lagorio
Reviews.Content: Took this to Maui, and I'm delighted with the results. Used it while snorkeling, the underwater pictures and videos turned out super. Then, when it was raining on and off in the mountains used it to take outside pictures and the quality was fabulous. It's very easy to use. I still haven't figured out all of the features, but I will. It's easy to change from picture taking to video. The big clip it came with kept it attached to my bathing suit. All in all, a fine camera and I believe it's going to get a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Works good so far
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L. Church
Reviews.Content: I have not had time to use all of the features and options, but the picture quality is good and it is durable.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera! I love the Microscope feature. it is just what I needed for work and very well priced

Reviews.Title: Great camera for adventures trips.
Reviews.Author: 2MZamora
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!! For travelling and water trip is recommended for nice pics..you cab use underwater It so fun and cool

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Only one little con.
Reviews.Author: Nang L
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! The pictures are great in quality. Night pictures are pretty good. Burst mode is pretty quick, but could be a little faster. You still have to try to predict what going to happen to time it right to capture fast action photos. The camera is pretty tough. I've dropped it a couple times. It keeps water out pretty well. I've gotten it wet many times snowboarding, surfing, swimming, and kayaking. It doesn't fog up.  I've yet to take it snorkeling, but I'm sure it will hold up.The only thing that bothers me is that it doesn't remember your shutter speed settings. Overall, its a great camera that I would recommend to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: Awesome quality!
Reviews.Author: Richard S. Blake III
Reviews.Content: I am still amazed by the close-ups!  And I've tested it out while running, and even while moving the photos come out great!  Bought it for running/hiking, as you never know what kind of weather you will get.  So far I am overly impressed.  Ergonomically this camera is great... fits in my hand while I run.  A great camera to take places that I don't feel like bringing in my large SLR.

Reviews.Title: 3rd in My series - love these cameras.
Reviews.Author: firewallbill "firewallbill"
Reviews.Content: Great camera - the perfect "throw it in the bag" or "stuff it in a pocket" camera.Pros -Yes, waterproof.  We have used them on vacation taking pictures of manatees, in pools, surf, etc. Truly waterproof.The optical improvements in the WG-3 make low light performance and color much better.Decent flash.Much faster to focus than previous generation.Take very good video as well.Simple, easy to understand menus for selecting shooting options.Decent zoom and wide angle modesGood macro ability - surprisingly good.Nice display on back - easy to see in broad daylight.Cons -Video is "noisy" - if you zoom you get a very distracting buzzing as the lens is moved by the cam motor.  Very annoying.Still not the fastest focus.Weird internal cable attachments - of course you have to open the bottom door to get to the battery, memory chip, etc.  There is a micro HDMI and charging socket.  Instead of using standard micro USB it has a weird connector - so don't lose it!  Frankly I found it more convenient to get an external battery charger with an extra battery, and just pull the memory chip and pop it into my computer.  Cable issue(s) avoided.Relatively short battery life.  Carry spares.So if you want a backpack, swimming, beach casual camera - this is it!  Wife and kids love theirs.  It's really kid proof, too.

Reviews.Title: Worthless for underwater
Reviews.Author: Ledfutt "Ledfutt"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for use while snorkeling. I used it quite a bit taking regular photos and it took nice pictures, certainly not good enough to warrant the price in my opinion, but decent pics. When I used it underwater as soon as it was immersed the LCD screen fogged over and stayed that way the whole time I was snorkeling. I attempted to use it a few times that day, trying different things, making sure the camera was not hot when I put it in the water, keeping it at water level, nothing worked. The screen was fogged the whole time rendering the camera useless because you can't see what you are shooting. I returned the camera and got my money back. I have an old Canon with an underwater case, while it doesn't take as clear a photo on land, at least I can see what I'm shooting underwater. If you are using this only for land pics, it's a nice camera, underwater, not so much. Terribly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camers.
Reviews.Author: Christine Meyers
Reviews.Content: Great Seller and fast shipping.  Love this camera.  Very easy to use.  Designed well for holding under water.  Clear photos and videos.  Underwater video function very cool.  Excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron markel
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Dropped it soon after purchase and no issues.  Also I used it under water with great results.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Seubert
Reviews.Content: I'm a pro photographer and I love this camera.  It doesn't have a delay like most, it's rugged (I've dropped it a few times) and waterproof.  It is always in a pocket for emergency shots, great to throw in a beach bag, and wonderful when working on water.

Reviews.Title: Worked great and took great pictures
Reviews.Author: T. Jones "Localbuzz"
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for our trip to Australia.  We used them for our excursion to the Great Barrier Reef and they performed great for our day of snorkeling.  No issues with water getting into the camera and we were in the water for 4+ hours.  Took lots of photos and video and they all came out great.  The only problem we had was that it was hard to see the screen underwater.  it was hard to see if you had what you wanted to take a picture of in the frame.  Other than that, this camera performed great.  definitely get the Chums Waterproof Camera Float.  Helps keep the camera on you wrist and it will float to the top if you happen to drop the camera while shooting pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not very competitive
Reviews.Author: Kyle "cylem"
Reviews.Content: Well Firstly I also own a Olympus TG-830, another waterproof/everything proof camera. I like it but it's fairly bulky, ugly and picture quality isn't the best. However It does have a lot of features that I just couldn't leave it for the Pentax.First thing I thought when I opened this box was, that this thing was MUCH larger than I thought. From the photos I had assumed it was a decently small camera (my fault for not looking further obviously) but this camera is really thick, and wide, just not really tall. It feels pretty good in the hands though, and I like the original design, and flare on it.Next i went on the the controls, this is one of the disappointments. Most other cameras give you a dial to quickly select modes, this you only have the option of going to a giant menu of all shooting modes and selecting from them, and when you select a special movie mode, you have to switch off it to take pictures again from what I saw. This is just not intuitive and gave me a bad taste.Camera operation was fairly speedy though, sometimes I had to double press the buttons (really have to give them a good push) and it didn't lag much. Taking pictures auto focused really quick, and startup was really quick too.Another thing I didn't like was the zoom, I understand the lack of zoom with the internal lense, I would like to see 5x like competitors but 4x isn't bad. The bad part is it doesn't include really any "SR" zoom like other companies. This lets you do a further zoom and the camera takes a larger pictures and crops it down allowing you to lose very little image quality. My olympus does 5x normal and 10x SR zoom.Features are pretty plentiful, i really really like what they did with the LED's, it helps taking certain types of pictures and is just a cool feature to have. Plenty of shooting modes, and it ever has 120fps video in 720p which is a feature I love to have.Overall, if the camera were less bulky, had better zoom function and button configuration I would really love it. however I would not really recommend unless it's features like the LED's or it's design are a must have.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great!
Reviews.Author: M. Wachholz "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Mexico for a week.  I took the camera snorkling twice (once for 1.5 hours, the other for 4 hours on and off all day).  Also had it in the rain for a bit.  Worked flawlessly.  A little hard to see the screen underwater, but much better than the last $80 waterproof camera I have.  I made sure to wash it off good after getting out of the saltwater, and then dried it.  Once we got back to the hotel, I took the battery out and left the door open to make sure everything dried out good.  No issues so far!

Reviews.Title: This is the BEST ruggedized camera
Reviews.Author: AMAZON CUSTOMER
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST ruggedized camera, shutter speed, image quality, battery life, GPS tagging, and Eye-Fi usable. Very nice UI.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says!!
Reviews.Author: caroline mann
Reviews.Content: My family just spent a weekend in a waterpark and it has definitely proven itself!  I chose this camera over Nikon or Cannon because it seemed less gimmick and more legit.  It is.

Reviews.Title: The fun camera
Reviews.Author: rrlady
Reviews.Content: We've taken pictures of the kids surfing, from eye level, gotten a few underwater shots, not worried when it fell in the sand. If you want more from your camera, get this one.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera with many features.  Would not purchase the GPS feature again as it is just a compass.
Reviews.Author: alan byerley
Reviews.Content: This is a great underwater camera with many features.  Features were a bit overwhelming to understand at first but practice makes it more user friendly.  Would like to have had a stronger zoom.  Unless you are looking for a simple digital compass, save your money and forgo the GPS feature as it is not a true GPS as thought. The GPS model does however offer a altitude/depth feature as well as a clock which is not offered on the non GPS models. You choose. This camera takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Mistress Widow
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a preorder so I spent more on it than what it sells for now. I'm not rich and I work hard for the money I have so buying something "big" like this means a lot to me. I love how I don't have to be scared of letting my little brothers or stepdaughter use this camera. They can drop it and I'm not scared it's going to pop apart and break easily. I love how I can literally take it anywhere with me, I don't have to worry about buying a disposable waterproof camera anymore and have my pictures damaged during development. Overall the photo quality is very good, it's hard to use underwater and see the photos but not because of the camera. You need to have good goggles on in order to really see what you’re photographing before doing so. The photos taken underwater were awesome. I've owned the camera for a little over a year now and I'm still very happy with it.Pros:Good picture qualityGood underwater picture qualityDurableLong-lasting battery lifeEasy to useCons:Charging (you have to leave the compartment door open in order to charge it, would have been more convenient if it charged the battery separately from the camera)

Reviews.Title: Kind of dissappeared
Reviews.Author: Anastasia Fomenko
Reviews.Content: This camera attract my attention because it was very durable and practically I breakable, but unfortunately the main reason why I got was to take pictures underwater and it did not do a good job doing so. The quality if pictures under water is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: battery died
Reviews.Author: Duzzie
Reviews.Content: It worked for the 1st 3 times. My battery doesn't work. Camera underwater was lower quality then I thought it would be. Its durable.

Reviews.Title: Maui trip in January 2014
Reviews.Author: David Pooley
Reviews.Content: The camera worked well above and below the water the video is great it was good even in poor visibility under water.I was Snuba diving down to 10 to15 feet and had no problems at all.Battery was not to bad could be a bit longer life but I am satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: steady improvement
Reviews.Author: oldcoot
Reviews.Content: I have had Pentax weather proof in earlier models they seem to improve with each passing model I do however recommend that every one who intends to own a weather camera thoroughly research their choice, to satisfy their own likes and dislikes .

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Gerald Thayer
Reviews.Content: The camera has great features for working in the rugged outdoors and harsh weather conditions. Recommended for work/sports in the great outdoors!

Reviews.Title: Nice Macro!
Reviews.Author: Keith Osborne
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned a 2008 Pentax W20 and for five years it served me through neglect and abuse around the world standing by for use. Which is why I opted for this upgraded model. I watched some of the abuse videos for it and was impressed.I have used the Macro features and they are very good. So far it has done everything I have asked. Video capability is ok as is the panorama feature.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: P McDonald
Reviews.Content: I have not used the underwater feature yet but it has more options and settings than my main camera.  Will be using it at the Great Barrier Reef.

Reviews.Title: real iceproof
Reviews.Author: Lin wei yi
Reviews.Content: I went to ski and used this camera to shot something. it is easy to use and suitable for sport.

Reviews.Title: this is a godsend for the fisherman
Reviews.Author: Baryshev
Reviews.Content: Favorite vacation - fly fishing. The camera allows you to take beautiful pictures underwater. Really like shooting macro, seen the smallest details.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: ED
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use in the field and easy to download pictures at home.  Takes great pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: Great rugged camera
Reviews.Author: D. Adkins
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son for Christmas and he loves it!  He is studying fisheries biology and it will be great for his research!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: bp
Reviews.Content: My battery came dead on arrival and did not work. I had to order a replacement battery and once that came the Camera is a must have for any vacation, or adventure. The color is vibrant and the camera is durable!

Reviews.Title: Good for fishing trips
Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: The camera was able to be used right out of the box to toy around with since I also purchased a memory card and backup batteries. There is a strong chance that this camera will fall into a lake at some point so I also bought a wrist buoy. This camera is great for a non-expensive but great quality option to throw in the tackle box.

Reviews.Title: Great for under water shots
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I used this camera to take pictures in the pool and at the beach. The camera takes great photos under water and in the sun. The shape of the camera is different but it fits nice in your hands. It is very responsive and simple to use. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Marlin Jones
Reviews.Content: In the last 5 months I have taken around 6000 pictures with this camera. It stopped working when I changed batteries in a wet location but was ok when I air dried it. I have not had it deep but takes nice snorkeling pictures. The compass seems to work well. The altimeter is not right on but show when I change elevation. GPS seems to work on it but have not tried ploting points on a map from it. Camera has lots of options I have not tried.

Reviews.Title: Great  little camera.
Reviews.Author: jwb1933
Reviews.Content: I have not been in the water with it, but I love its features and zoom. I may write more later.

Reviews.Title: Not for diving but you could use it in the pool
Reviews.Author: K. Koussa
Reviews.Content: Great for travel I tested it in water, wind, and drop it couple times.Recommended as small camera but not recommended for diving.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for the first time when I went swimming with the manatees. It took awesome pictures and video underwater. I was surprised at how clear the pictures were because I didn't seem to be focusing too well at times. I'm primarily a DSLR user but I liked this little camera. I'll definitely be taking it on more adventures!

Reviews.Title: Great equipment
Reviews.Author: slide112
Reviews.Content: It is a great tool with a variety of settings and options that assist me in my every day work... and easy to carry at a party or function.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Maria (WV)
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky with my cameras.  This is awesome!  The regular mode is great but it has a micro mode that blows me away.  I'm a scrapbooker and this gets great pictures every time.  The underwater option works wonderful.  I would buy this again.  It's been a great travel camera if I'm not in the mood to lug my big camera around.  Way better than my phone camera as well.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-3 GPS
Reviews.Author: J. Sayson "j1tanamera"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera ~ very rugged, and takes great pics.  Easy to use, lots of features, and best of all, its a PENTAX, so you know you have a great lense on the camera, and that it will be reliable.

Reviews.Title: i love this camera easy to use
Reviews.Author: marco cisneros
Reviews.Content: well, this is a really good choice for travellers or for anyone who wants to take photos everywhere it is easy to use it has an intuitive menu options panel ,take photos underwater??? pretty good at it , shockproof is usefull

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: colby herrell
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on this camera before I bought it, and the reviews were mixed. I decided to go ahead and take a chance on this camera anyway, and I'm glad I did. I absolutely love this camera!!!! I would recommend this to anybody who likes to take a lot of pictures in all different elements.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Tuff
Reviews.Author: Robert Glass
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Takes great photos.  Is tuff.  Drop it in the snow? No problem. Wipe it off and keep on going.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Great camera, good price.  I bought this to replace a pentax optio WPI before my son's birth.  This camera takes great pictures, even in low light, and starts up fast.  The old WPI was great and still functions fine, so I'm confident this camera will go the distance.If you're used to SLRs and fancy optics, this camera may not stack up, but if you're used to phone cameras, this will blow those out of the water.  Especially in low light.  Camera has a stabilization feature that works great for extended exposures.  Got some good halloween pictures of my niece and nephew without ruining the shot with the flash.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE this camera.
Reviews.Author: Florida Photog
Reviews.Content: It's great underwater and on land. We used it snorkeling and also at the beach.  It is lightweight and tough. The only thing I don't like is the caribiner strap, would rather have a real camera strap to put around my wrist. But I bought the floating strap so when in the water I'm OK.

Reviews.Title: From Kauai to Gerlach - this one is a survivor
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Murphy "it's not the wind, but the...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two different vacations - one on Kauai, where we planned to do some snorkeling - and the other one out to Black Rock City, known for dust storms.  Happy to say this little fellow did a great job in both environments.  Lots of different settings allow you to take great pictures in a variety of places.

Reviews.Title: replaced our WG-1
Reviews.Author: Duane R-H
Reviews.Content: We really liked our WG-1, but it had a fault that resulted in the screen going dark while trying to compose a photo. Before heading out for 10 days on the John Muir Trail we decided to replace the broken camera. The new model works better, having more range, more megapixels, and additional modes that we used. The new one is larger and heavier, but still fits in my pants front pocket where it is handy. A major improvement is the double latch on the battery/SD card door. We handed the camera to a number of people on the trail so that they could take our picture, and every one of them marveled and remarked about the camera. I particularly like the macro capability which I used to take photos of ants that fill the frame. I wish it had a bit more zoom, but with the size of the pictures I can crop to get the effect. Back at home I carry the camera to events where I am responsible for social media photos. I prefer using this camera to my Galaxy S4 because this camera is ready to go instantly and is much easier to hold. It is also less trouble to slip out the SD card for loading the photos into the computer than using the phone's cloud or cable-based solutions. We did not get the built-in GPS because of the delay it imposes and the way it sucks battery. Our 10 day hike used three batteries in this camera. I had bought the two extra batteries and a charger, and had the cable necessary to recharge in the camera from our solar panel, but made it on the three very light batteries we brought.

Reviews.Title: Pentax WG-3 camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Prewitt
Reviews.Content: Great versatile compact camera.  Only problem so far is difficulty in seeing in viewer for framing/zooming on bright sunlit days.

Reviews.Title: Nice durable camera
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I took the camera to a trip to havasupai. It performed well and took crisp pictures. I wish there was a controllable long exposure mode but one can't be to picky. I tried some under water shots and video of some small fast moving fish. The auto focus during video seemed it was struggling to keep up. The pictures turned out well. Overall a good purchase for what I intend to use it for which is a camera to strap on to my pack during backpacking adventures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: randy combs
Reviews.Content: Great product, bought camera for a ten week vacation in Thailand ,  the camera is everything I expected, very durable .It takes great pictures, I would recommend this camera to anyone that is hiking or exploring in the bush, mountains, jungle ect.  Very solid camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Adventures
Reviews.Author: Carson
Reviews.Content: We put this camera to the test!  We took it on a week and half long adventure in Utah and Colorado, and it took every abuse we put it through (dusty mountain bike trails, in the Colorado River, and many others!).  Great photos, amazing zoom, and dependable.  Great camera, and definitely worth every dollar!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Shana Van B
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband for his birthday after he had seen one a friend of ours took on vacation.  We both love it.  Not a single problem and it takes great pictures.  It has a huge view screen, and is cool looking.  It truly is waterproof as well.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: James W. Ficklin
Reviews.Content: This replaced my last Optio which failed at the very end of a Hawaii trip. I'll sent it in & see what it costs to repair the shutter button. Altho a bit heavier, I like the upgraded features on the WG3. It has a more secure battery/sandisk compartment with a lock. Menu access is basically the same. I was somewhat disappointed that the battery is a bit larger, so the batteries for my original Optio won't work & I had to buy more, but that's a fairly common ploy when it comes to upgrades. Takes great pictures; this is my outdoors/hunting/fishing camera & Optio fills that niche well.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: NEC Services
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera.  great pics.  works better than expected.Easy to use, clear pictures, rugged, and sturdy.The one thing I would enhance would be the buttons around the menu.  They are difficult to use if you dont have nails.

Reviews.Title: pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: L. Wosick "kindle lover"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Alaska. I like it. It's great for basic pictures and has lots of options. My only complaint is that when zooming in the picture get very digitized, Otherwise I worked out great. I used my digital 35mm DSLR for the  distant pictures. I would recommended this camera.

Reviews.Title: Took on JMT and photos were Grand
Reviews.Author: John Konopasek IV
Reviews.Content: Thus far can't say enough about the camera and the image quality.  I had the WG-1 (it was indestructible -- took it to the top of Mt Rainier with no sleeve on the outside of my pack and worked great -- but image quality was good), however the WG-3 the image quality is a huge upgrade (great shots -- especially with low light and the HDR setting).  I have some shots I turned into canvas posters.  Remember this is in the context of rugged cameras.  From the photos I've taken and the abuse its taken -- I recommend the WG-3 or the WG-1.

Reviews.Title: Wworks Grest
Reviews.Author: Chris Moon
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on a white water rafting trip with my son, we got completed soaked, camera still worked great even when wet and after being wet.  Was leary about the water proofness when I bought it but it worked like it was supposed to.  Is bulky compared to my other camera's, but they were not waterproof either so there is a trade-off is size is a consideration.  Also this camera DOES NOT use AA or AAA batteries so that is disappointing, but ordered the spare battery/charger kit  (wall and vehicle charger) and all is good.  Batteries last a long time too, so even though they are not AA/AAA batts, I do not have to buy batteries.

Reviews.Title: So far I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Bauman "bauman171"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I saw it on GMA Deals & Steals, promoted as being "adventure-prove" and (of specific interest to me) waterproof to 45 feet with a rechargeable battery.  I had been looking for a waterproof casing for my Canon Rebel T2i for when I go SCUBA diving.  Casings runs around $1,500, so the price tag on this camera (about 1/6 of the price of the casing) appealed to me as well as its versatility and compactness.Although I have not yet had an opportunity to take this camera SCUBA diving (and therefore test it's waterproof-ness), I have spent the last 2 months using it hiking and rafting in Glacier National Park, and so far I am very happy with this camera.First, it is very easy to use.  Anyone with any knowledge of a basic P&S; digital camera can pick this up and use it without reading the instructions, and it has all the standard camera settings for portraits, landscapes, moving subjects, etc.  But beyond that, even when choosing settings, the icon are accompanied by a brief description of what that setting does (ie, flowers with the outline of the flower softened, low light settings, movies, capturing images under water, taking underwater movie, stitches images to create a panoramic photograph, etc).The pictures are also pretty impressive; the camera is much more compact than my DSLR, and although zooming in closely on a moving object can take a bit more time than it does with my DSLR, but the pictures are very close in quality.  And the Pentax WG3 comes with a carabiner and strap so that I can easily attach the camera to my backpack.  Once I tried the image stitch for panoramic pictures, that became one of my favorite settings for out here at the park (you take the first picture and then a small portion of one end of that picture appears in shadow so that you can match that up to the get the next picture to line up with the first).One thing I would recommend would be to get a screen protector.  I meant to find one before I left on my trip but I forgot.  And while I will say that this camera has thus far been tough enough to withstand everything I have put it through, I have- on many occasions- forgotten that it was attached to the chest strap on my pack and when I take off my pack and lean it again a rock or a tree, I forget to protect the camera from slamming into the ground (or rock or tree).  Although the screen is still intact, it is starting to get a few little scratches in it and I intend to get a screen protector as soon as I get home, to protect it from further damage.The only other things I would recommend would be to consider purchasing a float wrist strap (the camera does not float!) and a backup battery.  Although the battery typically lasts me more than a full day of taking pictures, I did get a back up to take backpacking so that I don't have to worry about running out of juice and missing out on some AMAZING pictures!

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: outdoorsman1789
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer with DSLR's and P&S;'s.  This camera is amazing.  I take tons of pictures every day and I would rank this as one of the best point and shoot cameras I have ever used.  It is very fast and you can't compare to 5x optical in body for this price.  The photo quality far succeeded my expectation.  This little camera records in extremely good quality.  The slowmo feature is incredible.  The time laps works perfectly.  The Macro mode is stunning.  Underwater mode is incredible.  Every single feature is great.  Many people complain about the noise when you zoom.  It is loud... but its an in body zoom......... how could it not be loud?  This is a negligible flaw to me because I put music over every second of footage that I take.  All of the settings do what they sat they will do.  I only have 1 complaint, and that is that the screen gets scratched extremely easily.  Now, I know this is a rugged camera and it is put into positions that other cameras would not be in and that is mostly at fault.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU USE A SCREEN PROTECTOR.  I take VERY good care of my equipment and yet somehow this screen still managed to get scratched pretty badly.  I did't remove a star because that is what this camera is made for- getting abused.  It takes it very well. If you are considering a durable/underwater/everyday camera- BUY THIS PENTAX!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Love it.
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Conn
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I love it, Easy to use, tough, great manual, but you do need to read it to take full advantage of the camera, It does a lot but it also is easy to figure out how to use it, when you are out in the field taking pictures and no manual with you Rick

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was expecting great camera and excellent in rough weather, durable and all around great camera. LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: lj3rs
Reviews.Content: I originally got this camera for a trip to Alaska.  It supposedly rained a lot and I didn't want to ruin my SLR camera.  However it never rained the entire trip.  I did use the camera a lot however.  The telephoto is really nice and I used that instead of having to put my telephoto lens on the SLR or I would use it when the telephoto lens was on the SLR.  Most of the pictures came out the way I wanted them to.  Some of the shots of snow and/or glaciers came out too bright.  I should have tried the option for snow I guess.  I did try several of the options but usually just stayed with the program  option.  One issue I do have is that the button to zoom in is very close to the movie button.  Sometimes when I was framing a shot and wanted to zoom in some, I pushed the movie button instead and got an unwanted movie.  It does take very nice movies.  I used it instead of lugging my video camera around too.  It is a bit larger and heavier than some cameras but it fits in a lot of my pockets.  It is nice to have around when the grandbabies are around so I don't need to worry about it getting broken.  Before I wrote this review I did take it into the pool and took some underwater movies and still shots.  They came out nicely. The only other issue I have is that though it zooms in a lot, it you go too far the photos lose clarity.  Maybe if used on a tripod that wouldn't happen.

Reviews.Title: Camera pentax
Reviews.Author: JUAN D.
Reviews.Content: I boght this camera because i have one of the previous version and  works  very well!When this package arrives me, i will a complete summary of this product

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: PMills
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband for our family trip to Cancun.  It was everything we were hoping it would be.  Took really great quality pictures and the under water pictures were better than I expected.  It was great to have a camera in the pool or at the beach and not have to worry about getting it wet and ruining it.  I would recommend this for anyone looking for a reasonably priced waterproof camera for vacations or any water activities.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Myra Buck
Reviews.Content: Great camera, bought it for my husband before our vacation to Mexico and he loved it and used it everyday! He actually swam with it on his side or lounging in the pool so the camera was in the water all the time with no problems and the pictures were great!

Reviews.Title: Good image quality and functions
Reviews.Author: Vince.Lian
Reviews.Content: Good image quality and functions, with such a price to enjoy the high end underwater camera is nice.I hate Pentax for its DLSR, but I love this camera

Reviews.Title: Excellent! Great! Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Justin W. Rice "Justin"
Reviews.Content: Best rugged all weather camera on the market! Excellent delivery time coming from Canada to Florida. Well definitely consider purchasing from is seller again. As for the camera, the only flaw with this model and other models such as Olympus tough series, they do not offer a wall charger for the battery. I had to purchase one separately with 2 extra battery packs. Overall, great seller, excellent product, will definitely only use Pentax for my rugged digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Cassidy
Reviews.Content: This camera is both rugged and reliable. It takes great pictures. Have used it in a river but not at any depth. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A camera I don't have to protect with my life...
Reviews.Author: David Schlier
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase this camera because I wanted a camera I can take canoeing/kayaking/sailing without worrying about the expensive and delicate electronics if I should inadvertently go for a swim.  I went with this choice without GPS because I generally know where the shot was taken and can add it to the EXIF data if needed.  I went with the orange thinking the color would be easily spotted if dropped.The packaging is compact but protective.  The number of items is somewhat minimal: camera, power adapter, USB cord, battery, software and the manual.  I added a 8 GB class 10 SD card to hold what turns out to be a lot of shots (over 800 at highest resolution).  I also purchased  a charger and battery (Wasabi Power Battery (2-Pack) and Charger http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004W82GP8/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i02?ie=UTF8&psc;=1) because another reviewer mentioned the battery doesn't last long enough for a full day of shooting.I charged the battery using the power adapter/cord, plugged into the camera - worked fine.  After closing the battery/SD Card door and locking it, I started shooting.  The pictures are of good quality although stored only in JPEG (no DNG, no RAW, bummer). I found that I needed to have the manual next to me for the first session because the menu choices are varied (auto, manual, HDR, night, portrait, landscape, etc., etc with or without flast, red eye reduction, facial recognition etc., etc. using single point or broader focus, and exposure).  I am generally a manual or Tv or Av kinda guy with single point focus.  Anyway, I've taken about 200 shots with it so far and I'm impressed.The shots are sharp, the optical zoom works reasonably quickly, autofocus is reasonably fast.  The camera works well in low light conditions using auto ISO (another menu fuction!).  It takes nice macro pictures as well.  The menus, although occasionally obtuse, allow a wealth of shooting options which the photog in me loves.Some things to think about: the camera will sink - use a buoy wrist strap if you're concerned (sailing/kayaking - I'm concerned).  The color is only on the front so if it sinks and falls on it's front in lake muck, good luck finding it (see the buoy above).  Remember to keep the lens (cover? filter? whatever - the clear thing in front of the lens) clean as it is integral to the case - unlike other P/S cameras, there is no automatic lens cover that closes when turned off.  If it gets wet, you will have spots until it's cleaned.Disclaimer:  I shoot Pentax DSLRs.  I generally have to protect the lens/bodies with my body in inclement weather/people.  I am familiar with Pentax software but don't use it - I use Adobe Lightroom for import, organization, initial editing and publishing and Adobe Photoshop Elements and the GIMP for tweaking and detailed editing.  I purchased this camera because I am very familiar with the way Pentax organizes the menus, the WG-2 won at TIPA and outdoor magazines all give it a thumps up/best choice/it survived.

Reviews.Title: Great in Water
Reviews.Author: Brandon Wacasey
Reviews.Content: Maybe not the best picture quality, but everything about it is convenient. It does great in water and good with red eye.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Marty
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unique looking camera to take snorkeling. It's very rugged, looks cool etc. Took several pictures and video which look very good. I went snorkeling and made sure both locks were in the proper position. Camera was in the water for about 2 mins before the screen started fooging up. Then it went dead completely. When I got back on shore I checked the SD and battery compartment. It was dry so all my previous pics were saved. So, I don't know where the leak came from, but it needed to be returned.

Reviews.Title: Ruined my vacation.  Do not buy this camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this particular camera before I purchased it.  All were very good.  I was excited to take this on vacation to the Dominican Republic.  My wife and I were going to go snorkeling and planned a bunch of water activities that i was looking forward to capturing.  I took the camera on the snorkeling excursion and ten minutes in it stopped working.  Has not worked since.  Turns on briefly then flashes and does nothing.  Has basically ruined my vacation.  These are events and memories that cannot be duplicated.  Maybe I should ask Pentax to give me three thousand dollars so i can re-do the vacation.  I would not recommend this product to anyone who does not thoroughly test it out in the water before taking it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Burned out on the 2nd day of my honeymoon!
Reviews.Author: Chantelle du Plessis
Reviews.Content: The first time I used this camera underwater I noticed water drops inside the battery compartment. I continued to use it a couple more times and then while taking pictures of turtles on my honeymoon it gave me a message saying that it was turning off to prevent overheating. I waited a while and then tried to shoot again but got the same message. Then it shut off and never came back on again. I removed the battery and noticed that water must have gotten in and burned the sensors. They had already turned green. To be fair the shots I did get from this camera before it died were really great. Very clear, quality images. It might be good for other uses but not so much for underwater. Being a photographer I'm really disappointed that I didn't have the images I wanted to capture from my honeymoon but grateful I had a back-up camera for land use. Amazon refunded me for my purchase as well as the return shipping from Colombia. Great customer service on their behalf.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Tom Alford
Reviews.Content: I am an industrial hygienist and need a reliable camera for reports.  The close up feature of this camera is great.  My only complaint is sometimes it takes too long to focus and it has some night mode it slips into that makes the flash blink a bunch of times.  Although truthfully it could be user error.

Reviews.Title: Super!
Reviews.Author: dentalchick
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  We take this camera everywhere there is water!  It has been to the Bahamas and Mexico already and has taken some fabulous pictures.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Melinda Richards
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a family vacation and it turned out to be a great camera for the money.  I needed a compact digital for the trip and one I could use snorkling.  It took very good pics in lots of different lighting conditions, and the underwater pics were great too.  It is a perfect size and packs a lot of features into a small package.  Can't wait to take it with me rafting the Colorado River

Reviews.Title: Nice Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Stropus "mamadole"
Reviews.Content: Shopped for this camera in brick and mortar stores, as well as online. Amazon had the best price. We'll see what kind of pictures it takes. Looks easy enough to use.

Reviews.Title: BIG disappointment in picture quality.
Reviews.Author: J. H. M. "coolrabbit"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a huge disappointment! Pictures are grainy and fuzzy, regardless o the camera setting or the situation (indoors, outdoors, low light, bright light). I have tried it all and not a single picture comes out clear enough to use full-sized or edit well. I took several side-by-side shots with the WG-3 and an old (6 year old) Pentax 5m point and shoot camera, and the old one blew this one away with crispness and clarity of pictures. I am very disappointed, as this camera was definitely not cheap. To me, it's pointless to have a camera unless it takes CLEAR pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tough/waterproof camera!!
Reviews.Author: ryan
Reviews.Content: Have been searching for the best all around tough/waterproof/etc camera for my various adventures.  Finding one that did everything I wanted was turning into a choice having to sacrifice options.Have recently had Nikon AW100 & AW110, JVC Adixxion, Gopro Hero 3 black, Olympus TG-2, Panasonic TS-4 & TS-5, Pentax WG-10.....  after trying each one, I found this WG-3 to be "the one".  It does everything and more, and does everything "better" than the others!Underwater diving, moving dog pics, long range pics (28.8x zoom), lowlight pics (very strong flash), high speed pics (perfect slow motion), macro pics (amazing, microscope mode).It excels and takes great shots when and where the others fail or require multiple attempts to get a "great shot"!Every aspect seems highly engineered, it has every feature I need (and more!) and it seals up just as good as the AW Nikon does. I highly recommend this waterproof adventure camera!

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-3 WATERPROOF Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Walks Alone
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I flyfish, I hike, I bike, I kayak, I even run in the rain.  This camera is my 4th "Waterproof" camera.  All of the others handled the wet, but picture quality was not great.  This one not only takes great pictures, it is easy to hold onto with one hand, which is sometimes necessary in all of the outdoor activities I engage in.  It's also very intuitive and easy to learn.  I would recommend this camera to anyone that spends time in the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: I was tired of packing my DSLR for hikes and camping - and this camera has filled that void.  I'm using it mostly for taking snapshots while on the trail or ski hill.  Shockproof and waterproof give you piece of mind.  Electronic compass feature and GPS also lighten your load.  Picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Can't use GPS because...
Reviews.Author: G. Willard
Reviews.Content: The software to utilize the camera's GPS date crashes on my HP Pavilion laptop. It can't find the internet connection. It produces an error box full of script errors which I cannot stop or recover from.  The Registration part of the included software has NO problem finding the internet on my HP. Go figure.I did not like the image quality either.I have returned my WG-3  GPS after only one day of use.

Reviews.Title: No GPS
Reviews.Author: carson1975
Reviews.Content: took a little while to get this I end up ordering the purple one too. cause I wanted to GPS version. I must have missed that this color doesn't come as GPS model. Lame!

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Gibba
Reviews.Content: Good purchase ! I bougth this camera for my son (8 years), and were to wet n'wild to test.We are very pleased, take a lot of photos in different modes, I prefer use 16Mb pixel for a good quality.I was surprised ! recommend !

Reviews.Title: GREAT outdoor camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Keri Hamilton
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera for my husband to take backpacking and hiking.  This camera is perfect!!  It is lightweight, waterproof, and can take a serious beating!!!  Takes great movies also, which wasn't something I was specifically looking for however is an option we use all the time now.  We LOVE it; exactly what were are looking for!!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: FG
Reviews.Content: I really like this product, the brand is excellent, I recommend it. Would you purchase this item. good price and quality

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: stary90
Reviews.Content: It was what I was looking for, I just receive it, but the color is great, my favorite, just need to use it the see how does it work. The only bad is that this not coming with memory card. I  thought was included but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Tracy Townsend
Reviews.Content: This camera works just as advertized. Better photo quality than my SLR. Disposable underwater cameras don't begin to compare. Great macros shot too! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: good camera, rugged
Reviews.Author: allen sim
Reviews.Content: works great,  hard to focus in macro mode,  recommend using a tripod.The under water pictures look awesome! definately worth the $

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Janna H
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent purchase!  It is sturdy and has an appealing look.  The only issue I had was that the screen scratched a little so you will need a protector.  It got banged around a lot but kept on taking great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I do
Reviews.Author: Michael Barido
