Reviews.Content: I do bridge inspections and I love the outdoors. This camera is perfect. No worries about dropping it into the water or on something hard. Very durable.

Reviews.Title: Good Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: It's everything I was expecting. Going to Hawaii with the family and going to put this camera through it's paces.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of gear.
Reviews.Author: jeepjh
Reviews.Content: Has a powerful zoom although difficult to keep steady without tripod.  Still great function.  Takes great pics.  Bought it for my wife who really loves the look and feel.  Very tough and versatile and we are not afraid to take it kayaking, backpacking, or biking.  Still learning all the functions.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected!
Reviews.Author: Janet "J G"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last year just before going on a snow skiing trip, I chose it because it was waterproof and shock resistant... and I had not skied in over ten up years, so falling down was inevitable!From day one, the photos have not been clear, no matter what setting I choose! The only time I get decent photos is when the lighting is perfect, like on a sunny Florida day!I have even read some of the manual trying to find the right sweet spot and haven't found it yet!  It's either over exposed, slow and moved, or just completely out of focus! I am not happy with these at all since I have done better with much cheaper cameras!Don't know if anyone out there has figured out how to solve my problem, or if I'm just missing something trivial!Right now, based on my experience, I just don't recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy for the LED "ring flash" - useless more than 1" away
Reviews.Author: reluctant techie
Reviews.Content: Silly me thought that the ring of LED lights were as powerful as regular LEDs we all know and love. I was hoping it would provide a nice fill light for closeup shots but it is only for super close-up macro "microscope" mode where you place the lens on top of an object to take a close photo.Amazon accepted my return, I should have read the product info more closely. so beware...Those LED light on the front are so dim they don't light an image from more than an inch away.

Reviews.Title: Only had it for a day, but loved it!
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: I really loved this camera. It took excellent underwater shots with great clarity. I took it on the river for a "river float" the day after I received it. I dropped it in some rapids, and that thing SANK like a rock. I tried to dive down after it, but couldn't find it with the dark color and I was being carried away by the rapids. If you are going to take in the water, definitely get a float wrist wrap.

Reviews.Title: A camera, really?
Reviews.Author: Jim Black
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here on Amazon I purchased this camera expecting a good solid camera to take hiking. The camera is built solid and the software seems to be all that one would need to take pictures on the trail. But this thing takes awful pictures. Most pictures were over-exposed and out of focus. I tried for three days to make adjustments to the setting in order to get a decent photo. In actuality my iPhone takes better pictures. It is on it's way back to Amazon...

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a once in a lifetime trip.  Worked for 5 minutes and stopped. Do not buy this at all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: The earlier version was better
Reviews.Author: Gringo
Reviews.Content: I had the precursor to this camera and loved it.  It was light, slim, tough, inexpensive, and worked well.This one is not light, slim, and doesn't seem to work that well.  The ring of LEDs for macro is a gimmick with this lens.  This is not very competitive as a water proof point and shoot.  Look at the Nikon AW100 instead.

Reviews.Title: like
Reviews.Author: wang hongwei
Reviews.Content: I like it, and finally get what they want, it's just what I need, cheap and convenient transportation, like it very much。I like it, and finally get what they want, it's just what I need, cheap and convenient transportation, like it very much

Reviews.Title: My favorite
Reviews.Author: Frank R. Davisson
Reviews.Content: I have at least a half of dozen digital cameras, but this WG-3 is my favorite. It takes very good up close pictures and I like the fact that it's not btittle and easy to break.

Reviews.Title: Seller very good, this camera not so
Reviews.Author: Dennis M. Goodwin "Mista Bumpy"
Reviews.Content: Aloha!  I don't have anything to say about this camera, because I never got a chance to use it all that much - apparently the photo cell was bad from day one (it took defective pictures in low light and displayed those little rainbow lines around objects on the view screen.) and the zoom stopped working after a week or so.  I contacted the seller (PORTABLE GUY) and got return instructions by email.  Everything went well and my purchase money was credited to my account.  Nice service from this vendor.  The five star rating is for service only.  There is one thing, though, that this seller and others appear to require for their returns - ALL original packing, as well as all original components, even advertising fliers inserted in the packing for other products, and everything in good condition and appearance - seems to be the bottom line on all returns.  None others are considered, it looks like.  Now, this is understandable, esp. if a unit is repairable and has to be re-marketed as a refurb.  Here's the deal - if you're like me, you often toss all wrapping, or rip it down the middle in your mad, childish rush to get at your nifty purchase  I almost had to learn the hard way. Don't do it.  I saved my packing stuff because the box was so sturdy and I figured I could use it for something else.  I sure never anticipated a Pentax going west on me, and this is the first time it has happened.  Pentax usually makes good stuff.  Otherwise, I loved this camera, and some of the pics it did take were pretty decent.  Setup and controls are easy to use and this camera looks real strong.  I'm ordering another soon.  I'll do a review at that time.  Aloha!

Reviews.Title: Everything is fine
Reviews.Author: Alvydas Tamosiunas
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine. I like it. Thanks for the item, that was send on time. It has met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bruno Gomes
Reviews.Content: It comes with lots of options and menus, but for those used DSLR is quite easy the adaptation.Just works.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof...not so much on the older model! This one much better.
Reviews.Author: Whitney "Prime Fan"
Reviews.Content: I was a huge fan of the first generation pentax underwater and used that for quite a few years with no issues.This cameras version 2 model...ate it the first time underwater.  A shame because the features on this camera were fantastic.  When I say underwater, I mean snorkeling...it was never at any sort of depth and to be honest, it was in the water for maybe one hour.  I returned the camera but likes the features so much I have just ordered the WG3 and I hope it gets a better review than this.Update June 19. ..this version three is AMAZING.  No water leakage issues...it works even better above ground.  I do not like the underwater setting on this or any other camera, but the visibility thanks to the large view finder is great!  The photos are great!  The speed is fantastic under most circumstances....even with it the GPS I found the battery life very good, and the settings very close to the settings since the first generation which made this a snap for me.I am thrilled with the improvements on this 3rd generation ..purple..and yup, it's at attention getter.  My only advice..if you are going to use it in the water, get a floating strap, This thing is heavy , but in a good way because it's so rugged!  What an improvement from the 2nd generation!

Reviews.Title: Pentax
Reviews.Author: Venyamin Fradlin
Reviews.Content: It wass good as long as it last. Lost it in a midle of Costa Rica.Maybe should get a new one.

Reviews.Title: Poor image Quality
Reviews.Author: Johnny Hung
Reviews.Content: This is my first Amazon product review and the first product I'd ever returned after years of purchases from Amazon.  I am compelled to write this because of my great disappointment in the camera's performance.Within 5 minute on opening the Pentax WG-3 GPS, I had reboxed it and looked into the amazon return process at no fault of the seller or Amazon. Cameta Camera shipped it fast.First issue I noticed was that the focus cycled full range at every shot making the click to shot acquisition time excessive (1-2s).  This will not work for action shots or taking shots with children.  Even though the subject was in focus or very close to focus in the viewfinder, however, the camera lens mechanism would go through its full cycle from end to end trying to focus.  That is not acceptable in today's camera technology.  My cheap smart phone focus and shoot faster than this camera, which is not saying a lot.The few images I took in the few auto modes yielded grainy images with dull colors. My 6 year old cheap point and shoot Sony had better image quality and shot faster.I really had high hopes for this camera because of the F2.0 lens, QI charging option, and other great features.  I think I will wait and revisit the Olympus TG-2 or the Nikon AW 110.

Reviews.Title: Never got to try it
Reviews.Author: Holly Suitor
Reviews.Content: not sure where the problem was but the camera didn't charge -- it could have just been a bad battery but didn't have the time to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: NOT GPS unit
Reviews.Author: TEH "tehschhi"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easily confused with identical Pentad Optio's because the model number is the same (WG-3), but this one does not have GPS.  In every other way, it is identical to the WG-3 with GPS.  I returned it because I thought I was buying the GPS model...which I then ordered.  It is fantastic
